snippet: Shops say they are being forced to pay crippling federal taxes because of a law aimed at preventing drug dealers from claiming smuggling costs and couriers as write-offs.
abstract: Legal marijuana shops across United States are facing far higher taxes than other types of businesses due to decades-old law intended to prevent drug dealers from deducting smuggling costs from their taxes; situation reflects disconnect between expanding legalization of marijuana and federal bureaucracy that still criminalizes marijuana.
lead_paragraph: Shops say they are being forced to pay crippling federal taxes because of a law aimed at preventing drug dealers from claiming smuggling costs and couriers as write-offs.

headline.main: Legal Marijuana Faces Another Federal Hurdle: Taxes
headline.print_headline: Marijuana Merchants Face Another Federal Obstacle: High Taxes
